examples: She permitted her son to visit her estranged husband
I won't let the police search her basement
I cannot allow you to see your exam

results.definition: make it possible through a specific action or lack of action for something to happen
examples: This permits the water to rush in
This sealed door won't allow the water come into the basement
This will permit the rain to run off

results.definition: allow the presence of or allow (an activity) without opposing or prohibiting
examples: Children are not permitted beyond this point
We cannot tolerate smoking in the hospital
